fields.description:
Often customers wish to track things in JIRA without exposing the full complexity of JIRA's "create issue" interface.  For instance, a company may wish to track "leave applications" in a JIRA HR project, and present users with an extremely simple "leave application" form that results in an issue being created, and presents a simple "Your request has been submitted" confirmation page afterwards.  Another common example is where companies want to use JIRA as a ticketing system, and let their own customers file issues directly through a simple form.

If we had some sort of JIRA-aware form builder in Confluence, this would be ideal.  Eg. A company could embed the leave application form at the bottom of the leave application documentation, or could have a "support" space for customers to create tickets on.

If we had a JIRA form builder in Confluence, and a new Confluence-only license type, I imagine customers would be able to move many more business processes onto Studio, and Studio's appeal would broaden from developers to include those wanting more of an "extranet".
fields.summary: Simplified issue creation forms in Confluence

fields.description:
If I'm typing a comment in JIRA and I press control-S, it saves the comment.

If I'm typing a comment in Confluence and I press control-S, it saves the comment.

If I'm typing a comment in Crucible and I press control-S, it takes me to the Search page, and if my typing was quicker than the time it takes for auto-save to kick in, my comment is lost when I go back.

This has bitten me a few times. It looks like regular (non-Studio) Crucible doesn't actually have a shortcut for saving, but control-S just doesn't do anything, which is better than losing data. The control-S shortcut for saving seems to be something that comes from the Studio theme specifically.
fields.summary: Improve consistency of keyboard shortcuts between Crucible, JIRA & Confluence
Replace mock implementations (actually stubs) with mockito so that newly added method won't be sensitive to new methods added to an API

fields.description:
Strange but true: if you reconfigure Studio to not use the 'users', 'developers' or 'administrators' groups, and you use a Subversion 1.5.x client to perform a 'copy' operation with a user not in any of these groups, eg:

svn cp  https://example.jira.com/svn/TEST/trunk https://example.jira.com/svn/TEST/branches/1.0

The operation will fail, repeatedly prompting for your username and password:

Authentication realm: <https://example.jira.com:443> Subversion Repository
Password for 'jturner': 
Authentication realm: <https://example.jira.com:443> Subversion Repository
Username: jturner
Password for 'jturner': 
Authentication realm: <https://example.jira.com:443> Subversion Repository
Username: svn: PROPFIND of '/svntest': authorization failed (https://example.jira.com)

Other operations such as checkouts and commits work fine.
fields.summary: svn copy fails with Subversion 1.5+ client if user does not have access to the Subversion root

fields.description:

fields.description:
The 1.6.1 build broke today, because for some reason (unknown), User.logout() threw an exception, after setting the application on the web tester passed to it to FISHEYE.  Usually, it doesn't throw the exception, and ends up changing the application to JIRA.  Now, this caused every test after that to fail, because on this occasion, the tester passed to it was the JIRA web tester obtained from StudioFuncTest.getJiraWebTester(), which is the same tester that is used by JiraSetup, but JiraSetup doesn't set it to JIRA first (because it's the JIRA web tester), and so when it tried to load data into JIRA, it starts using FishEye and gets very confused.

The underlying problem is too many different testers and confusion when testers are passed between methods.  It's time that all deprecated calls on StudioFuncTest are removed.
fields.summary: Remove all uses of getJiraWebTester() etc in func tests

fields.description:
If I enter a search term in the quick search bar that corresponds to a project name, then select a project from the drop-down and search again, the search results are not filtered by anything.

For instance say I wish to search for the term "stream" in the JST project on studio.atlassian.com.  I enter "stream", and get some unwanted results from the DEMO project.  I then select "JIRA Studio" from the project drop-down and click "Search Again". The results are now completely irrelevant, and the search term "stream" has not been used.
fields.summary: Quick search fails when search term contains project name

fields.description:
Crowd's TokenReaper background job is failing every time it runs (once an hour), with a stacktrace:

2009-03-10 18:00:00,075 DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-4 ERROR [org.quartz.core.JobRunShell] Job DEFAULT.TokenReaperJob threw an unhandled Exception:
 java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token.hashCode(Token.java:207)
        at java.util.HashMap.put(HashMap.java:418)
        at java.util.HashSet.add(HashSet.java:194)
        at org.apache.commons.lang.builder.ToStringStyle.register(ToStringStyle.java:151)
        at org.apache.commons.lang.builder.ToStringStyle.appendClassName(ToStringStyle.java:1403)
        at org.apache.commons.lang.builder.ToStringStyle.appendStart(ToStringStyle.java:328)
        at org.apache.commons.lang.builder.ToStringBuilder.<init>(ToStringBuilder.java:255)
        at org.apache.commons.lang.builder.ToStringBuilder.<init>(ToStringBuilder.java:212)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token.toString(Token.java:216)
        at java.lang.String.valueOf(String.java:2615)
        at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:116)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.TokenDAOHibernate.remove(TokenDAOHibernate.java:70)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.TokenDAOProxy.remove(TokenDAOProxy.java:125)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.removeToken(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:1031)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.removeExpiredTokens(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:1014)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:310)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
        at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:20)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
        at $Proxy8.removeExpiredTokens(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.authentication.tokenreaper.TokenReaper.executeInternal(TokenReaper.java:34)
        at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)

That stacktrace is from Crowd 1.6.1 (Studio 1.6.1.0-RC2-20090310-01).  In Crowd 1.6 (Studio 1.6.0.1) the error is the same but does not contain a stracktrace:

org.quartz.SchedulerException: Job threw an unhandled exception. [See nested exception: java.lang.NullPointerException]
  at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:206)
  at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
* Nested Exception (Underlying Cause) ---------------
java.lang.NullPointerException
2009-03-08 14:00:01,470 DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-5 ERROR [org.quartz.core.JobRunShell] Job DEFAULT.TokenReaperJob threw an unhandled Exception: 
java.lang.NullPointerException
2009-03-08 14:00:01,470 DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-5 ERROR [org.quartz.core.ErrorLogger] Job (DEFAULT.TokenReaperJob threw an exception.
fields.summary: Crowd TokenReaperJob breaking with NullPointerException

fields.description:
Since 1.6 some users have reported being unable to add Confluence content, because the license has expired. The license page shows the license to be the "Studio Bootstrapping License".

According to James this is because Confluence is not picking up license changes from disk, including the initial change where the bootstrap license is replaced by the real one.
fields.summary: Confluence not picking up license changes

This should appear in the Wiki sidebar list of the global admin, as 'Default Space Permissions'

fields.description:
In some Studio instances where we have imported Subversion directories, the paths for projects does not match the Studio project key. Eg. {{/SiteConfiguration}} might be mapped to {{SITE}}.

Unfortunately in this case, Fisheye's "Source information" tab displays the wrong information:

{noformat}
This project is using Subversion. You may check out the source code by running: svn checkout https://test.jira.com/svn/SITE/trunk SITE --username sysadmin
{noformat}

The URL should be https://test.jira.com/svn/SiteConfiguration/trunk.

If this were fixed, then along with AOD-1308, Studio should be fully able to use non-key top-level directories.
fields.summary: Fisheye displays wrong Subversion URL when Subversion path does not equal key

fields.description: When viewing a Crucible review in JIRA Studio, it only shows the first line of the "Statement of Objectives" (generally populated from the commit message). Standalone Crucible has a plus button that lets you expand from the first line to show the full text, but in the Studio theme this button is absent. See the attached screenshots.

fields.description:
We are using magic password to configure repository permissions when creating new studio project. 

Instead we should use trusted app authentication and use current user to access fisheye api  and configure repository permissions. This is currently not possible because only sysadmin can access Fisheye API. User who creates a project is regular admin, not sysadmin.

Fisheye needs to support 2 types of admin roles: regular admin and a sysadmin.

The Atlassian Team
{quote}

fields.description:
The Confluence WYSIWYG editor has a problem where it sometimes slows down processing pages with lots of &nbsp's - [CONF-13965|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13965].  Unfortunately this slowdown happens while in a transaction, consuming a database connection, and only 8 of these are required to completely hang Confluence.

We should upgrade to Confluence 2.10.2 as soon as it's released to fix this.
fields.summary: Confluence sometimes hangs when someone uses the wysiwyg editor
Write plugin to setup initial data for Fisheye
Write plugin to setup initial data for Confluence
Write plugin to setup initial data for Jira
Write plugin to setup initial data for Crowd

fields.description:
One problem in studio development is that after code change we need to rebuild and restart all applications. After restart we need to run functional test to set up initial data. That takes ~ 5 mins. With writing the code, and testing it can take up to 15 mins to see and test even small code change.

We should be able to improve this process if applications would be ready to use after they start - without the need of running functional test. 
That should also allow us 
 * restart applications separately, because each application would be immediately ready to use
 * solve the problem with crowd related exceptions - AOD-1354

So the idea is: Write a plugin for each application that will do initial setup as it's currently done in functional tests. This plugin should be used/deployed in testing enviroments only. I recommend to start with Crowd.
fields.summary: Create plugins for each application that will set up initial data for functional tests

fields.description:

 # Try to add Confluence content. You will get the (slightly nonsensical) error "This Confluence installation is not licensed for additional users"

You will get the same error.

Clicking the 'Refresh' button on the Confluence license page refreshes the license count, but Studio users do not have access to this and it should not be necessary.

In particular it is not possible to change the timeout before JIRA gives up waiting for Fisheye.  Changing this timeout is sometimes desirable, when Fisheye returns a long time to return anything.
fields.summary: Fix up and add link to Fisheye plugin configuration page

fields.description: Add a project key or other identifier to the Navbar drop down, so that 'Home' and 'Home' can be distinguished.
fields.summary: Add Project Key to Quicknav dropdown.
